text:
*[Bug 18918] subassignment from real to complex gives NA (rather than 0) imaginary part*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18918>

Sebastian Meyer (<mailto:seb.meyer@fau.de|seb.meyer@fau.de>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |seb.meyer@fau.de

--- Comment #1 from Sebastian Meyer (<mailto:seb.meyer@fau.de|seb.meyer@fau.de>) ---
This sounds reasonable to me. Sub-assigning a non-NA numeric to a complex
vector only changes the `Re()` part, so should sub-assigning `NA_real_`.

I'll leave this for closer review to those more familiar with the complex()
implementation, but I can provide additional check results for the patch (I
happened to have fresh checks for a subset of ~6500 packages, so last night I
had those rechecked with the patch): there was 1 newly failed test for each of
BIOC/SparseArray (in `test-NaArray-Arith-methods.R:393:5`) and CRAN/checkmate
(in `test_anyMissing.R:73:3`).
